newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek Singular OK's 0.55bln rights issue.
newsitem.headline: Greek Singular OK's 0.55bln rights issue.

text.p: Greece's information technology listing Singular got shareholder approval on Wednesday for a 549 million drachma rights issue, it said in a statement.
Singular will issue 219,640 new common registered shares, entitling existing shareholders to 30 new shares for every 200 outstanding at 2,500 drachmas.
Proceeds will be used to finance the 1995-99 investment plan totalling 1.4 billion drachmas which carries a 35 percent subsidy by Greece's ministry of development, Singular said.
Investments amounting to 379 million drachmas have been realised so far, it said.
Singular's pretax earnings were flat at 233 million drachmas in turnover growth of 19 percent to 1.778 billion drachmas in the fiscal year ending in June 1996.
Management sees earnings exceeding 350 million drachmas in the year ending in June 1997 and turnover of 2.35-2.40 billion drachmas.
Singular's shares firmed 50 drachmas to 3,200 on Wednesday on minimal liquidity of 400 shares.
